dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: November 12th, Singles Day—Alibaba's massive shopping event is just around the corner.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: November twelfth, Singles Day-Alibaba's massive shopping event is just around the corner.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinasand the worldsbiggest online shopping event, known as Singles Day, takes place on November 11, with Alibaba and a record number of other Chinese e-commerce companies offering massive discounts over the 24-hour period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, and it's expected to hit, like, $37 billion in sales this year, which is just mind-blowing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, and it's expected to hit, like, thirty seven dollars billion in sales this year, which is just mind-blowing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It has become by far and away the largest shopping event in the world, raking in just over $30 billion in gross merchandise volume last yearand sales are expected to hit $37 billion by that same metric this year, according to Forrester Forecasts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And it all started back in 2009 with just 27 brands participating. Now there are over 200,000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And it all started back in two thousand nine with just twenty seven brands participating. Now there are over two hundred thousand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Singles Day rose to prominence when Alibaba successfully launched its first shopping festival on that day in 2009; now re-branded as 11/11, the event boasts over 200,000 participating brandsup from 60,000 in 2017 and just 27 in 2009.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That growth is insane. And this year they're adding 1.1 million new products? I mean, how do you even browse that many?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That growth is insane. And this year they're adding one point one million new products? I mean, how do you even browse that many?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The e-commerce festival is expected to be bigger and more international than ever in 2019, with Alibaba increasing the range of items on sale and adding 1 million new products on offer this year, the company said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it's not just Alibaba—U.S. retailers are jumping in too. Almost 25% of them are getting involved, according to Adobe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it's not just Alibaba-U.S. retailers are jumping in too. Almost twenty five percent of them are getting involved, according to Adobe.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A larger number of U.S. retailersalmost 25%, according to Adobe, plan to get involved, including big names ranging from Apple to Estee Lauder, posting deals on Alibabas platforms as well as their own U.S. websites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but there's a catch though—almost 80% of Chinese shoppers said they plan to boycott American goods because of the trade war.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but there's a catch though-almost eighty percent of Chinese shoppers said they plan to boycott American goods because of the trade war.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Almost 80% of Chinese shoppers said that they plan to boycott American goods during Singles Day, according to a recent survey from AlixPartners, which predicts the U.S.-China trade war taking a toll on participating U.S. brands this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oof, that's gotta hurt for brands like Apple and Estée Lauder who are trying to cash in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof, that's gotta hurt for brands like Apple and Estée Lauder who are trying to cash in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A larger number of U.S. retailersalmost 25%, according to Adobe, plan to get involved, including big names ranging from Apple to Estee Lauder, posting deals on Alibabas platforms as well as their own U.S. websites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But Alibaba's pulling out all the stops—they've got Taylor Swift headlining the opening gala this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But Alibaba's pulling out all the stops-they've got Taylor Swift headlining the opening gala this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba, which kicks off the event by hosting extravagant fashion shows and concerts, is also bringing in more starpower: Taylor Swift is set to perform as the headliner in the opening gala this year, while Kim Kardashian did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for the shopping festival.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: No way! Last year Kim Kardashian was doing livestreams for her fragrances on Tmall. The star power is real.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! Last year Kim Kardashian was doing livestreams for her fragrances on Tmall. The star power is real.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Alibaba, which kicks off the event by hosting extravagant fashion shows and concerts, is also bringing in more starpower: Taylor Swift is set to perform as the headliner in the opening gala this year, while Kim Kardashian did a livestream on Tmall to launch her fragrances for the shopping festival.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just celebrities—gamification and social media are huge parts of the experience now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just celebrities-gamification and social media are huge parts of the experience now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Experience is becoming widely seen as one of the keys to the festivals success, for example through celebrity endorsement and the gamification of the Alibaba platform.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Sophie Cheng from FutureBrand China mentioned video-driven e-commerce is taking off big time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Sophie Cheng from FutureBrand China mentioned video-driven e-commerce is taking off big time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Social media and especially video-driven e-commerce, which has taken off in recent years, is expected to be an even bigger part of the shopping bonanza this year, according to Sophie Cheng, general manager at FutureBrand China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's like the Super Bowl for brands, just like Jiang Fan said. They go all out to impress Chinese consumers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's like the Super Bowl for brands, just like Jiang Fan said. They go all out to impress Chinese consumers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Think of 11/11 as the SuperBowl for brands, Jiang Fan, president of Alibabas Taobao and Tmall businesses, told CNBC. Its an opportunity to pull out all the stops to wow Chinese consumers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And this is the first year without Jack Ma at the helm, which is kind of a big deal too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And this is the first year without Jack Ma at the helm, which is kind of a big deal too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 2019 will be Alibabas first year organizing 11/11 without founder Jack Ma at the helm, after Chinas richest man stepped down from his position as chairman in September.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True. But the show must go on—and it sounds bigger and more international than ever.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True. But the show must go on-and it sounds bigger and more international than ever.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The e-commerce festival is expected to be bigger and more international than ever in 2019, with Alibaba increasing the range of items on sale and adding 1 million new products on offer this year, the company said.
